thread.section_title: Alexis Sanchez’s sulking shows why he is not world class, says Arsenal ‘Invincible’ Jens Lehmann – Metro
thread.title: Alexis Sanchez’s sulking shows why he is not world class, says Arsenal ‘Invincible’ Jens Lehmann
thread.title_full: Alexis Sanchez’s sulking shows why he is not world class, says Arsenal ‘Invincible’ Jens Lehmann

author: Chris Davie
title: Alexis Sanchez’s sulking shows why he is not world class, says Arsenal ‘Invincible’ Jens Lehmann
text:
Alexis Sanchez is not a ‘big player’, according to Jens Lehmann (AFP/Getty Images) Alexis Sanchez should not be considered as a world-class player because of his attitude, according to former Arsenal goalkeeper Jens Lehmann.
The Chile international has been in excellent form for the Gunners this season, scoring 18 goals and registering nine assists in 27 Premier League appearances.
But Lehmann has questioned the 28-year-old’s mentality, having been at the centre of several flashpoints with team-mates in the dressing room and on the training ground in recent weeks.
‘They talk about Sanchez being a big player – but if you are sulking, you can’t be a big player,’ the former Germany international told The Sun.
‘You must be a big player mentally – not just be good at dribbling.’
Lehmann has questioned Sanchez’s mentality. (Getty Images) More: Football Antonio Conte report card: Near-perfect start with Chelsea on course for the double 
Transfer targets to deadwood: How Arsenal could line up next season amid talk of overhaul 
Arsenal star highlights major flaw in Arsene Wenger's set-up 
Lehmann has also taken aim at Mesut Ozil and Shkodran Mustafi.
‘There’s always a question with Ozil – how much can he contribute when it gets tough?
‘It’s not Mustafi’s fault someone has paid £35m for him. If someone buys me for £35m, the next day I’m not a better player.
‘He is giving everything. But sometimes the team concede five, so he has to ask himself if it’s good enough?’
MORE: Arsenal star Alex Oxlade-Chamberlain unitentionally highlights major flaw in Arsene Wenger’s set-up 
MORE: Arsenal put Alexis Sanchez and Mesut Ozil up for sale
